# cgColor

**Instance Property**

A Core Graphics representation of the color, if available.

## Declaration

```swift
var cgColor: CGColor? { get }
```

## Discussion

You can get a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGColor] instance from a constant SwiftUI color. This includes colors you create from a Core Graphics color, from RGB or HSB components, or from constant UIKit and AppKit colors.

For a dynamic color, like one you load from an Asset Catalog using [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Color/init(_:bundle:)], or one you create from a dynamic UIKit or AppKit color, this property is `nil`. To evaluate all types of colors, use the `resolve(in:)` method.
